intro: Dicoria canescens subsp. clarkiae, commonly known as Clark's dicoria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
